title: bug(forge): overlapping nested remappings are not resolved
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [x] Foundry
- [x] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

`forge 0.2.0 (02e430c 2023-07-21T00:24:08.481175000Z)`

### What command(s) is the bug in?

`forge build`

### Operating System

macOS Silicon

### Describe the bug

## Problem

#5397 added support for remapping contexts (closing #1855), however, the implementation does not handle all edge cases yet.

Suppose you have a project structure like this:

```tree
project/
└── lib/
    ├── foo/
    │   └── lib/
    │       └── openzeppelin-contracts  
    └── bar/
        └── lib/
            └── openzeppelin-contracts
```

In both `foo` and `bar`, `openzeppelin-contracts` is remapped to the following:

```bash
@openzeppelin/contracts/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/
```

The bug is that only one of the two remappings gets resolved, not both.

## Error Log

Sneak peek:

>  Unable to resolve imports: "@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol"

See the full log [here](https://app.warp.dev/block/NzkoqBiRAVrpY7IW8d5M0r).

The issue is that only the `v2-core` remapping appears in the auto-detected remappings:

```bash
lib/v2-core:@openzeppelin/contracts/=/Users/prb/Sablier/examples/lib/v2-core/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/
```

## Reproduce

1. Clone [sablier-labs/examples](https://github.com/sablier-labs/examples) at commit [eae781](https://github.com/sablier-labs/examples/commit/eae781627e15d963a62c1545fe0944ad94d5519c)
2. Remove the `permit2` remapping in `remappings.txt`
3. Run `forge build`
